title: Sales data of July reflects a positive outlook for the Indian automobile industry: SIAM
description: In July, Indian passenger vehicle sales reached 3,41,510 units, up from June's 3,37,757 units. Two-wheeler sales rose 12.5% to 14,41,694 units, while three-wheeler sales grew 5.1% to 59,073 units. Despite a 2.5% decline in passenger vehicles year-on-year, the overall outlook remains positive with growth expected from festive season boosts
content: (You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channel)
